respondent: James Earl Carter, President of the United States, et al.

wikiData.title: Goldwater v. Carter
wikiData.FullName: Barry Goldwater, et al. v. James Earl Carter, President of the United States, et al.
wikiData.Prior: Judgment for defendants, 481 [[F. Supp.]] [https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/FSupp/481/949/2397673/ 949] ([[D.D.C.]] 1979); reversed, 617 [[F.2d]] [https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/appellate-courts/F2/617/697/41409/ 697] ([[D.C. Cir.]] 1979)
wikiData.Holding: Whether President Carter could unilaterally break a defense treaty with Taiwan without Senate approval was a political question and could not be reviewed by the court, as Congress had not issued a formal opposition. The case was dismissed.
wikiData.LawsApplied: [[Article Two of the United States Constitution#Section 2: Presidential powers|U.S. Const. art. II, sct. II]]
